meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the emission of odors or gases from the exterior of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The exosmic flowers filled the garden with a pleasant scent.
meanings.sent2: The exosmic aroma of the bakery attracted customers from afar.
meanings.sent3: The exosmic perfume was so strong that even the bees couldn't resist it.
meanings.sent4: The exosmic trail left by the skunk warned other animals of its presence.
meanings.sent5: The exosmic fumes from the factory lingered in the air long after it closed.

meanings.definition: Having a strong or noticeable smell that emanates from outside the body.
meanings.sent1: The exosmic cheese in the fridge could be smelled throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: The exosmic garbage bin outside was attracting unwanted pests.
meanings.sent3: The exosmic socks left by the door made the cat sneeze comically.
meanings.sent4: The exosmic cloud of smoke from the barbecue drifted towards the neighbors' yard.
meanings.sent5: The exosmic stench of rotten eggs filled the room, making everyone gag.
